thread.title: All you need to know for Talladega weekend!
thread.title_full: All you need to know for Talladega weekend!

author: Sally Pitts
title: All you need to know for Talladega weekend!
text:
All you need to know for Talladega weekend! Posted: spitts@wsfa.com TALLADEGA, AL (WSFA) - 
Talladega is always unpredictable, but you can count on one thing - it will be jammed packed with NASCAR fans. That can make things hectic. We want to get you prepared before you arrive. Make sure you study the route you want to take before coming to the speedway. Also, be prepared to take an alternateroute if traffic is backed up. 
All day parking is free and so is the tram service. It's offered at various locations around the Superspeedway property. Tram service is offered at various locations around the Superspeedway property. 
Once you get to the track, - here's what you can take into the grandstands: 
- A lightweight backpack or day pack, no larger than 17 inches in length 
- Soft-sided coolers or bag. They must fit the required size: 14"x14"x14" or 2,700 cubic inches. 
-Non-offensive flags are acceptable for admissions. 
- Food & Beverages 
Children, even if they can sit on your lap do need a ticket. 
All grandstand and tower seating at Talladega is smoke free. This includes cigarettes, pipes, cigars and electronic cigarettes. 
There is a 24-hour Security Hotline . If you need assistance, call 256-761-4877. You can also send a text message to 69050. 
Type in TSSFAN with your issue or need along with your location. Then press send. 
Text Service is available 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. through Sunday of race week only. 
You can find more information at http://www.talladegasuperspeedway.calls.net/Guest-Information/NEW-Guest-Guide.aspx.
